meanings.definition: An object of fear or alarm
meanings.sent1: The dark shadows in the room at night can sometimes seem like bugaboos to young children.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie was full of bugaboos that made the audience jump in their seats.
meanings.sent3: The little dog barking loudly at the vacuum cleaner as if it were a bugaboo was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The old abandoned house stood on the hill like a bugaboo from a ghost story.
meanings.sent5: The eerie sound coming from the attic made the idea of a ghostly bugaboo seem real.

meanings.definition: A source of dread or anxiety
meanings.sent1: The thought of failing the test was a bugaboo that kept him up at night.
meanings.sent2: The looming deadline for the project became a bugaboo for the team.
meanings.sent3: The idea of having to speak in front of a large crowd was a bugaboo for the shy student.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds on the horizon were a bugaboo signaling an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The uncertainty of the future was a bugaboo that haunted her thoughts constantly.

meanings.sent1: The bugaboos of traffic and road closures delayed their journey.
meanings.sent2: Finding a reliable internet connection while traveling can be a bugaboo for remote workers.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn jar lid that wouldn't open became a bugaboo during dinner preparation.
meanings.sent4: The lack of funding proved to be a bugaboo in the development of the new project.
meanings.sent5: Overcoming the bugaboos of self-doubt and procrastination was key to her success.
